etymologies: late 19th century. From trop- + -a-, connective element (perhaps compare scientific Latin Atropa) + cocaine

definitions: An alkaloid having effects similar to those of cocaine, first isolated from Javanese coca, and (formerly) used as a local or spinal anaesthetic.

notes.text: Tropacocaine is a tropane alkaloid which is the benzoyl ester of a stereoisomer of tropine (pseudotropine). Formula: C₁₅H₁₉NO₂.
